title: Should I buy Nami?
body:
Hey guys, I see Nami{{champion:267}}  is on sale and I am looking to buy a couple new champs.  I main support and I usually roll with Morgana{{champion:25}} , but she's not ideal for all comps.  When this used to arise, I would play Taric{{champion:44}}  because he was still worthwhile.  Now I would say that as a support, Taric is outclassed by pretty much all other viable supports.

The pros and cons as I see them are-
Pro:
AOE-Knockup CC x2
AOE heal that also does damage

Cons:
Squishy
Very avoidable knockup
Hard to play aggressive early

I see Janna{{champion:40}} as a similar champ to Nami and I have trouble playing Janna.  However, I have never tried Nami to see if she's very different.

What do you think?  Would I like her or should I save my money?

replies.body:
She's an incredibly effective and useful support, and nowhere near as difficult to play as people make her out to be. If you play support a lot, then yeah, she's definitely a worthwhile pickup.

She's also the best support for Yasuo, so that's fun.
Thank you all for your comments, based on that I have bought Nami and am surprised at how good her engage is and how aggressive I can be, she's still really soft but items/runes can help.

The whole reason why I started playing {{champion:267}}  was because, unlike {{champion:40}} , she can be played really aggressively. The other reason is just because Aqua Prison, if you can land it, gives you a decent amount of control that a lot of squishy supports don't have until later on ({{champion:37}}, I'm looking at you).  She is squishy, but so are most caster supports (you don't realize how high {{champion:25}} 's base armor is until you play her), but that usually isn't a problem with the build I use, specifically due to {{item:3190}} , {{item:3047}} , and  {{item:3028}} as well as a decent amount of armor/magic resistance on my runes. I don't know if {{champion:267}}  is necessarily the most viable support, but she competes with {{champion:412}}  for title of the most adaptable support.

Yeah! You can totally be aggressive with her ~ her W has a pretty significant range. 

I used to be a Sona main, and at the time, she was getting picked pretty frequently in my games, and I wanted to pick up another champion with a heal. Since then, I've been playing Nami nonstop. :3

Braum, Morganna, Zyra tier 1
I'd put her in the next tier with thresh, karma, and leona though.

Elite nami's hit q's.  That's it.  There's really not any skill involved in spamming w, and very little skill involved in "is my adc shooting them? cast 'e'...oh he's not?  then I'm not wasting mana".

Can you land vel'koz e and cho rupture?  Regardless if you end up playing nami, just practice the q in bot/normals, you'll be so glad you did.
